channel.title: Project Insanity command player rights
channel.description: How do i make it so you need a certain player right to type a command on Project Insanity?

item.title: Project Insanity command player rights
item.dc:creator: @24jared24 24jared24
item.description:
@24jared24 wrote:

try

if (playerCommand.equals("command") && c.playerRights == 3){ //code }

That would set it to only player right 3 but if you want player rights 1-3 like mod to owner, then try this

if (playerCommand.equals("command") && c.playerRights >= 1 && c.playerRights <= 3){ //code }

that second one might not work but… might idk

Read full topic

item.title: Project Insanity command player rights
item.dc:creator: @doggybeard1 doggybeard1
item.description:
@doggybeard1 wrote:

[quote=“egyptmo21, post:2, topic:356678”]Go into your server files, then go to src, then in server, then model, then players, then packets, then you will find a java file called commands ope it, and then search for playerRights and all the commands for that playerright will be under it until you see the next playerrights

Or just add this after every command

change 3 to 1, 2, or 3[/quote]

I know exactly what your talking about, but the part that i’m stuck on. I have custom donor yells with player rights that are 5, 6, and 7. But they can also use all of the commands the owner (player rights = 3) can use. I wanted to change it to where maybe it would be like when i give a player player rights 5 because they donate for a custom yell, i want the commands to be where donors can do ::yell and have their tags , but i don’t want them to be able to do owner commands. Is there a way i can put like a playerRights restriction?

Read full topic

1 moder 2 adminstore 3 owner or co owner

item.title: Project Insanity command player rights
item.dc:creator: @egyptmo21 egyptmo21
item.description:
@egyptmo21 wrote:

Go into your server files, then go to src, then in server, then model, then players, then packets, then you will find a java file called commands ope it, and then search for playerRights and all the commands for that playerright will be under it until you see the next playerrights

Or just add this after every command

&& c.playerRights >= 3) {

change 3 to 1, 2, or 3

Read full topic
